speaker: Mary Alice
content: So, what did Carl say when you confronted him?
mark: confront 面对，面临；正视，处理；对峙，对抗；对质，当面对证

speaker: Susan
content: You'll love this. He said "It doesn't mean anything, It was just sex."

speaker: Bree
content: Ah, yes, page one of the philanderer's handbook.
mark: philanderer 花花公子
handbook 手册，指南

speaker: Susan
content: Yeah, and then he got this Zen look on his face, and he said, "you know, Susan, most men live lives of quiet desperation."
mark: zen look 禅意造型：一种简约、自然、平静的外表造型  zen 禅；禅宗

speaker: Lynette
content: Please tell me you punched him.
mark: punch v. 用拳猛击（某人或某物）n. 一拳，一击；

speaker: Susan
content: No, I said, "Really? And what do most women live? lives of noisy fulfillment?"
mark: fulfillment n. 履行；实行；满足
lives of noisy fulfillment 充满喧嚣的满足感的生活

speaker: Susan
content: I mean, of all people, did he have to bang his secretary? I had that woman over for brunch.
mark: bang 猛敲，砰然重击；猛摔；很响地使劲关上；与……性交；砰砰作响
have sb over for... 邀请某人过来（做某事），for后面通常接名词，说明邀请的目的

speaker: Gabrielle
content: It's like my grandmother always said an erect penis doesn't have a conscience.
mark: conscience 良知，良心；内疚，愧疚 have a conscience. 有良知；有良心

speaker: Lynette
content: Even the limp ones aren't that ethical.
mark: ethical 道德的，伦理的；合乎道德的；

speaker: Bree
content: This is half the reason I joined the NRA.
mark: half the reason 一半原因；部分原因
NRA National Rifle Association 全国枪支协会 Rifle 步枪，来复枪；步枪队

speaker: Bree
content: Well, when Rex started going to those medical conferences, I want it in the back of his mind that he has a loving wife at home with a loaded Smith & Wesson.
mark: conference （大型、正式的）会议，研讨会；（小型正式的）商讨，讨论；体育协会（或联合会）
in the back of one's mind 在某人的潜意识里；在某人脑海深处
Smith & Wesson 枪支【Smith&Wesson(史密斯威森 )公司以制造手枪闻名于世，其制造生产的产品遍布各阶层】

speaker: Mary Alice
content: Lynnie, Tom's always away on business. Do you ever worry he might?
mark: be away on business 出差；因公外出

speaker: Lynette
content: Oh, please, the man's got me pregnant 3 times in 4 years. I wish he was having sex with someone else.
mark: get sb. + adj. 使某人处于某种状态

speaker: Bree
content: So, Susan, is he gonna stop seeing that woman?
mark: gonna 即将，将要（即 going to）

speaker: Susan
content: I don't know. I'm sorry, you guys, I just don't know how I'm gonna survive this.

speaker: Mary Alice
content: Listen to me, We all have moments of desperation.

speaker: Mary Alice
content: But if we can face them head on, that's when we find out just how strong we really are.
mark: face them head on 直面困难  head on 迎面地
